Name: InspIRCd
Overview:
InspIRCd is a modular Internet Relay Chat (IRC) server written in C++

It was created from scratch to be stable, modern and lightweight. It provides a tunable number of features through the use of an advanced but well documented module system. By keeping core functionality to a minimum we hope to increase the stability, security and speed of InspIRCd while also making it customisable to the needs of many different users.

NOTE: If you want to change the hostname turn on 'Advanced View' and at the 'Extra-Parameters' change '--hostname=YOURPREFERREDHOSTNAME'

The container will create a TLS certificate at first start or if the certificate isn't found in the 'conf/' directory, after it is created you can import your own certificate.

HASH CREATION NOTICE: Read the discription from the variable 'Operator Password Hash' how to create the hash from your password.

@attributes.Name: TCP4 - Server, TLS
@attributes.Description: TCP Server Port (Encrypted - You don't have to forward this port if you use this as a standalone IRC Server)

@attributes.Name: Data Path
@attributes.Description: Your configuration is located in '.../conf/' (WARNING: change the main configurations via the variables here and not the files which say that you should don't edit them)

@attributes.Name: Domainname
@attributes.Description: Suffix used behind the server name (in this format '.example.com')

@attributes.Name: IRC Network Name
@attributes.Description: Name advertised as network name

@attributes.Name: Admin Name
@attributes.Description: Name showed by the /admin command

@attributes.Name: Admin Nick
@attributes.Description: Nick showed by the /admin command

@attributes.Name: Admin Email
@attributes.Description: E-mail shown by the /admin command

@attributes.Name: DNSBLs
@attributes.Description: Set to no to disable DNSBLs (DNS-based block list - set to 'yes' or 'no')

@attributes.Name: Connection Password
@attributes.Description:
Password either as plaintext, or hash value - if you don't want a password leave this variable empty
(Make sure you escape special chars like $ or & if needed)

@attributes.Name: Connection Password Hashing algorithm
@attributes.Description: Hashing algorithm for the Connection Password  - if you don't entered a password leave this variable empty (e.g. hmac-sha256, hmac-md5, hmac-ripemd160, md5, ripemd160, sha256)

@attributes.Name: Operator Name
@attributes.Description: Oper name

@attributes.Name: Operator Host
@attributes.Description: Hosts allowed to oper up (If you don't want to connect OP's from outside change for example to '*@localhost' or what your hostname matches that the OP should connect)

@attributes.Name: Operator Password Hash
@attributes.Description: Hash value for your oper password hash (to generate a password hash create the server without the hash, connect to the InspIRCd and type in: '/mkpasswd HASHMALGORITHM PASSORD' eg: '/mkpasswd hmac-sha256 superstronpassword')

@attributes.Name: Operator Password Hashing algorithm
@attributes.Description: Hashing algorithm for the Operator Password - if you don't entered a password leave this variable empty (e.g. hmac-sha256, hmac-md5, hmac-ripemd160, md5, ripemd160, sha256)

@attributes.Name: Operator SSL Only
@attributes.Description: Allow oper up only while using TLS (set to 'yes' or 'no')

@attributes.Name: Certificate - Name
@attributes.Description: Common name of the certificate

@attributes.Name: Certificate - Mail Adress
@attributes.Description: Mail address represented in the certificate

@attributes.Name: Certificate - Unit Responsible
@attributes.Description: Unit responsible for the service

@attributes.Name: Certificate - Organisation
@attributes.Description: Organisation name

@attributes.Name: Certificate - City Name
@attributes.Description: City name

@attributes.Name: Certificate - State
@attributes.Description: State name

@attributes.Name: Certificate - Contry
@attributes.Description: Country Code by ISO 3166-1 (to get the country code visit: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1)

@attributes.Name: Certificate - Certificate Expiration
@attributes.Description: Duration until the certificate expires

@attributes.Name: Services - Connection Address
@attributes.Description: Specify the IP Address from where the Services are connecting (if you run Anope on the same Unraid machine it is usually the IP address of Unraid)

@attributes.Name: Services - CIDR Allow Mask
@attributes.Description: CIDR of services source IP (If you run your Services on the same Network as your IRCd you don't have to fill in this value)

@attributes.Name: Services - Hidden
@attributes.Description: Hide services from /MAP and /LINKS (valid options are: 'yes' or 'no', change only if you know what you are doing!)

@attributes.Name: Services - TLS
@attributes.Description: Turn on TLS encryption for the Services link (this is be no proble if you connect it to your internal network since it only talks internally to your Services).

@attributes.Name: Services - Password
@attributes.Description: Password send by this server and send by the services
